body:
Comment 4: 
The gofmt program enforces details of brace placement and indentation, among other
things.  It does not enforce every single detail of a program.  Besides not inserting or
removing blank lines, it also does not remove line breaks in the middle of expressions,
nor does it reformat comments.

The primary goal of gofmt, which I believe has been achieved, is to prevent arguments
about minor details of coding style.  It is not necessary to turn every input parse tree
into the exact same output file to meet that goal.  For example, this is the first
message I can recall questioning the handling of blank lines.
